pair.Prompt: In the case of Northern Securities Co. v. United States (1903), what was the purpose of the combination of the Great Northern and Northern Pacific Railway corporations?
pair.Response: Response: The purpose of the combination was to form a holding corporation through which the scheme of combining the two companies should be executed, and under which the holding corporation would become the custodian of the stock of the two companies, and manage both lines of railroad as if held in one ownership.
